casebody.data:
The State of Ohio, Appellee, v. Townsend, Appellant.

[Cite as State v. Townsend, 100 Ohio St.3d 246, 2003-Ohio-5758.]

(No. 2003-1241 Submitted September 23, 2003 Decided November 12, 2003.)

{¶ 1} The discretionary appeal is allowed.

{¶ 2} The judgment of the court of appeals is reversed, and the cause is remanded to the trial court to apply State v. Comer, 99 Ohio St.3d 463, 2003-Ohio-4165, 793 N.E.2d 473.

Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, O’Connor and O’Donnell, JJ., concur. Lundberg Stratton, J., dissents. Lundberg Stratton, J.,

dissenting.

*247Peter J. Wagner and Andy P. Hart, for appellant.

{¶ 3} For the reasons expressed in Judge Grady’s dissent in State v. Comer, 99 Ohio St.3d 463, 2003-Ohio-4165, 793 N.E.2d 473, ¶ 28-39, I respectfully dissent.
